titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Corporation, Auditor FA869

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-03-02 14:25:37 -0500.

revisiondesc.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection does not include the following audit reports, but they are mentioned in minutes:

1910-1911 Haskins & Sells. 1911-1912 and 1912-1913 A.B. Bierck. 1914 Price Waterhouse. 1915 Bebbington, Higson.... 1916 A.B. Bierck. 1917 Judson, Higson and Clark. 1918 A.B. Bierck. 1919 Arthur Young. 1920 A.B. Bierck. 1921 Arthur Young.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Rules of the Board of Trustees adopted in 1911 provided for an annual audit of the books of the Treasurer and also the books of account of the Board of Scientific Directors by an auditor or auditors appointed by the Board of Trustees who shall be a person or persons not connected with the Board.

Changes in By-Laws in 1966 provided that an Audit Committee consisting of not less than three and no more than five members of the Board of Trustees elected at the annual meeting recommend the appointment of independent public accountants to audit the accounts of the Corporation and review the reports submitted by such accountants and advise the Board of Trustees thereon.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of the RAC.

did.unittitle: "The Rockefeller University Financial Statements. (With Accountants' Report Thereon)" Peat, Marwick, Mitchell, and Co.
